cyclone.name: KAY
cyclone.current_location: about 275 miles WSW of Acapulco, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to continue west-northwest, then turn northwest and north-northwest toward the southern Baja California peninsula by mid-week, remaining well south of the U.S. West Coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Baja California peninsula (near Cabo San Lucas)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southwestern Mexico coast from Guerrero to Jalisco and the Baja California peninsula
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late week, but gale-force winds are unlikely (<5% probability).
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate showers possible late week as outer moisture feeds northward; totals expected well below 4 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased swell and dangerous rip currents along the Southern California coast beginning late week could disrupt small-craft and harbor operations.
